finding.problemType: OWASP Dependency Check: Libraries with known vulnerabilities
finding.description:
A finding identified by the external 'OWASP Dependency Check' plugin: bootstrap.min.js
===================== --------------------- CVE-2018-14040 --------------------- CVSS V2 Score: 4.3 CVSS V3 Score: 6.1
National Vulnerability Database of NIST reports: In Bootstrap before 4.1.2, XSS is possible in the collapse data-parent attribute.
The vulnerability in the library is assigned by the National Vulnerability Database of NIST to the CWE: CWE-79 =====================
===================== --------------------- CVE-2018-14041 --------------------- CVSS V2 Score: 4.3 CVSS V3 Score: 6.1
National Vulnerability Database of NIST reports: In Bootstrap before 4.1.2, XSS is possible in the data-target property of scrollspy.
The vulnerability in the library is assigned by the National Vulnerability Database of NIST to the CWE: CWE-79 =====================
===================== --------------------- CVE-2018-14042 --------------------- CVSS V2 Score: 4.3 CVSS V3 Score: 6.1
National Vulnerability Database of NIST reports: In Bootstrap before 4.1.2, XSS is possible in the data-container property of tooltip.
The vulnerability in the library is assigned by the National Vulnerability Database of NIST to the CWE: CWE-79 =====================
===================== --------------------- CVE-2019-8331 --------------------- CVSS V2 Score: 4.3 CVSS V3 Score: 6.1
National Vulnerability Database of NIST reports: In Bootstrap before 3.4.1 and 4.3.x before 4.3.1, XSS is possible in the tooltip or popover data-template attribute.
The vulnerability in the library is assigned by the National Vulnerability Database of NIST to the CWE: CWE-79 =====================
